seo.title: Smartlook Alternative
seo.description: Compare OpenPanel with Smartlook: pricing, features, and deployment. OpenPanel offers product analytics with self-hosting; Smartlook combines analytics with session replay.

hero.heading: Smartlook alternative
hero.subheading: Need product analytics without requiring session replay? OpenPanel is an open-source alternative to Smartlook that focuses on event-based analytics, funnels, and retentionâ€”with self-hosting and transparent pricing.

competitor.name: Smartlook
competitor.short_description: Combined product analytics and visual insights platform with session recordings, heatmaps, and event tracking. Acquired by Cisco in 2023.

summary_comparison.title: OpenPanel vs Smartlook: Which is right for you?
summary_comparison.intro: Both platforms offer product analytics, but Smartlook adds visual behavior tools (session replay, heatmaps) while OpenPanel focuses on event-based analytics with self-hosting.
summary_comparison.one_liner: OpenPanel is open source with self-hosting for product analytics; Smartlook combines analytics with session replay and heatmaps.
best_for_openpanel: Teams needing self-hosting for data ownership and compliance
Focus on event-based product analytics without visual replay
Teams wanting unlimited data retention with self-hosting
best_for_competitor: Teams needing session recordings to watch user interactions
UX designers requiring heatmaps (click, scroll, movement)
Mobile app crash reports with linked session recordings
Teams wanting combined analytics and replay in one tool

highlights.title: Key differences at a glance
highlights.intro: Here's how OpenPanel and Smartlook compare on the factors that matter most.

feature_comparison.title: Feature comparison
feature_comparison.intro: OpenPanel focuses on product analytics; Smartlook combines analytics with visual behavior insights.

features.name: Crash reports with replay
features.notes: Smartlook links crash reports to recordings

technical_comparison.title: Technical comparison
technical_comparison.intro: For developers evaluating analytics tools, here's how the implementations compare.

items.label: SDK size (JS)
items.notes: Smartlook's SDK includes session replay code

pricing.title: Pricing comparison
pricing.intro: OpenPanel offers event-based pricing with free self-hosting. Smartlook uses session-based pricing.

openpanel.description: Start at $2.50/month for 5,000 events. Self-host for free with unlimited events. All features included at every tier.

competitor.description: Free tier: 3,000 sessions/month with basic features. Pro: $55/month for 5,000 sessions with extended retention and exports. Enterprise: Custom pricing for 50,000+ sessions.

migration.title: Migrating from Smartlook to OpenPanel
migration.intro: Moving from Smartlook to OpenPanel involves transitioning from combined session replay and analytics to event-based product analytics.

steps.title: Understand feature differences
steps.description: OpenPanel focuses on event-based product analytics. If you rely on session recordings and heatmaps, consider using complementary tools like Microsoft Clarity.

steps.title: Create OpenPanel account or self-host
steps.description: Sign up for OpenPanel cloud or deploy self-hosted using Docker. Configure your project settings.

steps.title: Install OpenPanel SDK
steps.description: Replace the Smartlook snippet with OpenPanel's SDK. Install via npm or use the CDN. For mobile apps, install the appropriate native SDK.

steps.title: Map events and properties
steps.description: Convert Smartlook's event tracking to OpenPanel's event structure. Set up user identification using identify() to track users across sessions.

steps.title: Build analytics dashboards
steps.description: Create funnels, retention charts, and cohort analyses in OpenPanel to replace Smartlook's analytics.

sdk_compatibility.notes: Both use similar event tracking APIs. Main difference is OpenPanel doesn't automatically record sessions.

historical_data.notes: Historical session recordings from Smartlook cannot be migrated. Event data may be exportable depending on your Smartlook plan.

use_cases.title: Where OpenPanel is a better fit than Smartlook
use_cases.intro: OpenPanel shines when you need product analytics with data ownership and don't require visual replay features.

items.title: Product analytics & growth
items.description: Deep event-based analytics with funnels, retention analysis, and cohorts. Stronger retention and cohort capabilities than Smartlook.

items.title: Data ownership & self-hosting
items.description: Complete data control with self-hosting. Smartlook is cloud-only with no self-hosting option.

items.title: Open source requirements
items.description: Full transparency and customization with MIT license. Smartlook is proprietary (now Cisco-owned).

items.title: Unlimited data retention
items.description: Self-hosted OpenPanel has unlimited retention. Smartlook limits data retention even on paid plans.

items.title: Cost-effective for high volume
items.description: Event-based pricing or free self-hosting. Smartlook's session-based pricing scales up quickly.

faqs.title: Frequently asked questions
faqs.intro: Common questions about switching from Smartlook to OpenPanel.

items.question: Can OpenPanel replace Smartlook's session recordings?
items.answer: No, OpenPanel does not provide session recordings or heatmaps. If you need visual behavior analytics, consider using Microsoft Clarity (free) or Hotjar alongside OpenPanel, or continue using Smartlook for recordings while using OpenPanel for deeper product analytics.

items.question: Which tool has better funnel analysis?
items.answer: Both tools offer funnel analysis. Smartlook's advantage is the ability to watch session recordings of users who dropped off. OpenPanel offers more advanced funnel customization and cohort breakdowns.

items.question: Can I self-host Smartlook?
items.answer: No, Smartlook is only available as a cloud-hosted service (now part of Cisco). OpenPanel offers both cloud hosting and self-hosted deployment via Docker for complete data ownership.

items.question: What happened with Cisco acquiring Smartlook?
items.answer: Cisco completed the acquisition of Smartlook in June 2023. Smartlook is being integrated into Cisco's AppDynamics platform. The Smartlook product continues to operate independently.

items.question: How does pricing compare?
items.answer: Smartlook uses session-based pricing with a free tier of 3,000 sessions/month and paid plans starting at $55/month. OpenPanel uses event-based pricing with 10,000 free events/month. OpenPanel's self-hosted option is completely free with unlimited events.

items.question: Does OpenPanel support mobile apps?
items.answer: Yes. Both platforms offer mobile SDKs. OpenPanel supports iOS, Android, React Native, and Flutter with event tracking. Smartlook additionally supports Unity, Cordova, and Xamarin with session replay capabilities.
